page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Sunninghill is an Anglo-Saxon name and with it comes a mountain of history waiting to be told.Through the ages Sunninghill/Sunningdale have been places to come and enjoy the clean and salutory waters.In Regency times the area was an important Spa and the atmosphere was one of music,dancing and refined splendour.This was not so in the 17th Century when people came to the area to escape the effects of the deadly plague.With Windsor Great Park on its doorstep the area maintains its links with Royalty. Road names give a clue to some the pastimes pursued by the gentry e.g.Kennel ride, Huntsmans Meadow etc.Apart from name evidence the local history may be revealed by other "clues"e.g. Norman arch in Sunninghill Church and Broomhall Farm-formerly Broomhall Nunnery dissolved by Henry V111.
